content: in this legal case the viru county court made a decision regarding the division of joint property between two parties the court awarded compensation to one party and ordered the other party to give consent for the ownership of the property to be entered into the real estate register the court also stated that the procedural costs would be borne by the parties based on the civil code the legal proceeding began when one party filed a lawsuit demanding the division of joint property the parties involved got divorced and have common property acquired during their marriage the plaintiff acquired an apartment which is now part of the joint ownership the plaintiff estimates the market value of the apartment to be 50000 euros with the defendants share valued at 25000 euros the defendant wants sole ownership of the apartment and is willing to pay the plaintiff 11000 euros the plaintiff explained in court that they bought a new apartment before receiving the judgment and the defendant disputed the ownership of the apartment the court instructed both parties to submit evidence regarding the market value of the apartment after reviewing the evidence the court partially satisfied the claim and ordered the transfer of ownership to the defendant the court also determined the procedural costs based on the civil code

metadata.cost: Unspecified procedural costs to be borne by each party on their own
